name: places/ChIJrxhFWlZZwokRvLsbGSWf9N4
adrFormatAddress: 636 Broadway #1200, New York, NY 10012, USA

originalText.text: Everything was fairly good and smooth. I would say the process took a lot longer than expected. And once we got the lease we weren’t asked how long we wanted our term to be. I asked to change it to 2 years. We only had 24 hours to sign once the lease was sent to us. She said she would get back to us; but she didn’t within the 24 hours. So we felt we had to sign the 1 year so we didn’t lose the house. Still trying to get it to two years now .

originalText.text: Very frustrating. You couldn't save the application before completion which is impractical when you're getting interrupted several times a day. If you could review the whole application, which is too lengthy, you could at least get what you needed in front of you. You couldn't back track to edit information. Co-Applicants had to fill out the same information which is redundant.  I have a very good credit score, but was requested to pay 2 months security not 1, which doesn't make sense.

originalText.text: Everyone needs to realize that their issues are with individual property managers and not Findigs.  I actually use Findigs in my business and the product they provide is great, it allows for a quality and clear application and a great in app communication tool.  It is excellent software and they have helped improve my business!

I actually use Findigs in my business and the product they provide is great, it allows for a quality and clear application and a great in app communication tool.  It is excellent software and they have helped improve my business!

originalText.text:
Dealing with Findigs has been an ongoing headache for the last few weeks. Applied for a house, approved, deposit paid, lease SIGNED.

I have an emotional support dog and valid letters from my therapist who I’ve been seeing since 2020. These letters and all vet records have been provided to the Findigs pet verification team and yet I’m still being given the run around because the letter does not specifically state the breed of my dog (which is not legally required). They send harassing emails at 7am and multiple times throughout the day requesting an updated letter even though I’ve explicitly stated that my therapist is OUT OF OFFICE.

The letter even states that clinicians and psychiatrists are not required to prescribe a “specific animal” but they are hung up on her adding an additional line to the letter stating that my dog is a boxer even though they ALREADY have VET RECORDS stating that my dog is a boxer! There is no phone number to directly speak to somebody and after every email response, it seems I’m handed off to somebody new - woohoo!!!

At this point if the property management company didn’t already have my deposit money, I would leave this damn property alone for the simple fact that Findigs has been awful to interact with.

At this point if the property management company didn’t already have my deposit money, I would leave this damn property alone for the simple fact that Findigs has been awful to interact with.

originalText.text: We had a very poor experience with home River group after we applied. Calling the general number or the moving coordinator, goes to a general pool of people and no one could answer any questions I had. Each person referred me to a different person, but wouldn’t give me a direct number for any of the people I needed to call. My property manager is the main one I apparently needed to be in contact with and when I finally got his number, he was the nicest and most helpful. Abigail who deals with underwriting and lease was very rude to me when she talked to me on the phone. She would constantly interrupt me and make it difficult to get a hold of her. When things are outsourced, it’s very difficult to get anything done or get the appropriate information needed. This was the most difficult leasing group  I’ve had to deal with.
